intro: Ligusticum peucedanoides, commonly known as Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-shaped clusters. It is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and medicinal properties. Ligusticum peucedanoides is valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
